Allow me to explain why I'm about to drop $800 for a fake piece of paper:

1. I HATE paper. I hate shlepping an overstuffed briefcase full of notebooks, folders and binders everywhere, having to constantly organize them and taking forever finding stuff. I hate having to print stuff out every day contributing to the mountain of waste. It's inefficient, cumbersome, noisy, ecologically unsound, and frankly unhealthy. 

2. My college professors have effectively banned the use of phones, laptops and tablets in class (which I believe is absolutely absurd but that's for another post), but *this* I'd get away with!

Yes the price rather outrageous, but for the gain in convenience, I would spend twice that. The only thing it is lacking is the ability to highlight in color, but... well, there's gotta be something for me to spend all my money on next year!

My Psychology of Personality textbook uses Kurt Cobain as a model for psychoanalysis. I'm not sure how I feel about that... 

I also question the authority of the biography used. According to Jack Endino (who knew him very well), Azerrad is the only one to be trusted.

Reliability issue aside, since I happen to be an Adlerian, here's a section I find particularly interesting:

According to Adler's theory, the fundamental driving force in personality is the struggle to move from a "felt minus" to a "felt plus" situation. This coalesces to a fictional finalism,  a view of the goal of a person's striving. In Cobain's case, according to his biographer (Cross, 2001 ), Kurt explicitly and adamantly expressed this goal to a friend at age 14: "I'm going to be a superstar musician, kill myself, and go out in a flame of glory" (p. 34). That would achieve the goal of being noticed and arousing empathy and guilt in others. The paradox of the success and the self-destruction was captured in a crayon drawing that he made: "a stick figure with a huge smiley face for a head, chopping off his left leg with an axe. The title reads: 'Mr. Sunshine Commits Suicide"'(Cross, 2001 , p. 129).

Cobain's parents doted on him when he was a young child, according to  his  biographer (Cross, 2001 ), but at age 3 he was "deÂ­throned," as Adler would express it, to  share their attention with his baby sister. He seemed to cope by becoming very close to his sister KimÂ­berly. Later, his parents   divorced and his mother, in her new marriage, turned her attenÂ­tion to another child, depriving Kurt even further of parental attention. He was shuttled from one home to another, and sometimes was not welÂ­come in either, crashing instead with other relaÂ­tives, neighbors, or outdoors. Adler's theory emphasizes sibling rivalry as an important conÂ­tributor to personality, and he considers the jealÂ­ousy of the oldest child for younger rivals to be a significant trauma that can  lead to emotional disturbances, even when parents do not split up. Even at age 24, Cobain was distressed enough about his sister to include, almost at the beginÂ­ning of his autobiography, the reminiscence that in childhood, his sister had destroyed his new tin drum set. Cobain tried to earn his father's love by living up to the expected role for a male adolescent, playing sports, but it was not a good fit for him, thus contributing to his feelings of inferiority. Adler describes an inferiority comÂ­plex as a neurotic outcome, and Cobain's conÂ­tinued embarrassment at his own skinny body is evidence that he suffered such an inferiority complex.

Adler would understand the background factors contributing to Cobain's troubled personÂ­ality. However, Adler held each person responÂ­sible for choosing his or her own style of life. Childhood neglect is a challenge, but  others with situations as difficult and even worse have been able to compensate for what was missing in their lives and move on to a socially useful style of life.

media.title: A modest dillema
media.description: Recorded this while walking around campus today.

data.post: Recorded this while walking around campus today.

Just fired the blog back up, after a 3 year break!

We have gone full-nerd. That means, among other things, referring to myself as "we".

This was a good idea! Too bad I made the #1 mistake.

If you want to avoid this common trap, and be somebody who accomplishes things instead of just talking about them, take this piece of advice, and next time you come up with a great idea...

DON'T TELL ANYONE!!! JUST DO IT!!!

Yes, when we think of a perfect idea the obvious response is to announce it. Then we receive positive feedback, which ought to encourage us but it turns out that the psychological effect is just the opposite-your mental reward system gets a phatty dopamine hit for a goal that you have done no work towards accomplishing.

THIS DIMINISHES MOTIVATION AND GREATLY REDUCES LIKELIHOOD OF FOLLOW-THROUGH. 

So here's my new idea- I'm gonna start a club.

First rule of my club: We don't talk about ANYTHING.

Second rule: Don't talk about it. Just do it!

Third rule: Shit! I already broke the first 2 rules!

I have to write an essay over the weekend... it has to be really good. 

Already we have a problem... I've got writer's block because I'm setting the bar too high... 

[ EDIT: When at some point you begin to consider yourself a *writer*, and develop a standard of quality in your work, you have at once manifested the obstruction; because the creative process must be free of all judgement. You must be willing to write terrible things in order to have a chance of producing anything good. But of course it will suck either way... for no good writer ever believes they are a good writer. And I, in my quasi-pseudo-humility, happen to believe I am a fine writer. Which means I am really a sucky writer. Stupid sucky writer... stupid sentences, all disjointed and stupid... ]  ]

[This essay] has to be extremely personal. And sensual, as in vivid descriptions of sights, sounds, smells, etc.

The assignment is to describe a day of our life that stands out as having great significance.

This should be a piece of cake... but it's not. It's damn near impossible...

I'm forced to search and express what about my life has great significance. OK, well... I'd have to say,

Music, friends and family. Alright, that's a start... but we need to pick a certain day that established this in a monumental way. 

These things are a monster... Writing about myself is often the hardest thing of all to get inspired about...

This first week of Fall term started off in absolute characteristic fashion, knowing full well that any given set of my typical daily interactions will undoubtedly reveal the most extreme, insane, grotesque corners of human civilization.

This shit needs to be in a book:

Going to my first class. What could possibly go wrong, as I board the bus to ride 1.5hrs to this high school where my English Comp course is held?

Well, the ticket machine is broken, the thing into which you put your money - so the driver informs me that since I can't pay my fare she cannot give me a ride!

So what do I do? (You're starting to catch on, I know it...) just a wild guess, hmmm?

That's right....

FREAK OOOOOUUUUUT!  I have to get to class!

So she says she'll get the supervisor on the phone. Not only was I allowed to ride but I rode for free! But this isn't even the point of the story, it just happened to be another funny thing that occurred on the way. A practice catastrophe, a supplemental warm up for our ascent to Mt Fucked....

Luckily I anticipated having no clue where I was going and allowed extra time, because this place was a maze!

A funny feeling came about me as I entered the high security part of the school. I felt their eyeballs pretty much burning me as I walked into the office, proudly declaring that I'm lost. They tell me to sit down and I am promptly escorted by security into another room, the grown-up version of the principal's office. No joke... I tell them I'm here for class and give the instructor's name.

They then inform me that this class is only for students enrolled at that school.

In other words.... I went to my class, and they wouldn't let me in!

I spent the whole rest of the day, and half the night, trying to figure out how to deal with this... it spiraled into a scheduling nightmare, as I was utterly incapable of finding classes that would work at this point. I decide I need to sleep on it, and see the counselor in the morning so they can help me figure out my schedule... it was completely messed up..... (which is actually) totally normal.

However, I did end up figuring out a solution once my head cleared - I just needed the advisor to give approval that I be allowed to join another english class that is already in session, since it was completely not my fault! What, they make a class exclusive, but then fail to tell you, let you register and arrive only to kick you out!

The counselor agreed with me passionately, and was actually appalled that the sign up was so unclear that something like that could happen.

What resulted from this whole thing is that at the last minute all my classes had to be switched around so they could be masterfully assembled into an impossible order that can only exist in the presence of a specific concentration of dark matter. So it was all reshuffled; new teachers, new classmates, new daily routine.

And I'm quite pleased with the outcome. These be sum reeeeaal teeeeaacherrrs ....

Gotta say tho, there be a whole lotta  butthurt among the teachers over cellphones and computers and stuff.... oh boy, it just lights their buttholes on fire with kerosene and sandpaper and salt and a generous heaping of horseradish. 

Smeared all up in their butts.

Chopin never named his compositions, because doing so plants an image in your mind and detracts from your imaginative potential. But despite that, this one piece featuring an incessantly repeated note that starts to wear a hole in your head like the Chinese Water Torture... became known as the "Raindrop" Sonata...

When I do it though, it really turns into something to cry about...

Note: I do not remember making this! I mean... I totally did, no doubts there. But how in the world did I get the idea to do Chopin on a harmonium with an automated filter and a dance beat?

Finally got a real computer. Amazing, I can actually do stuff!

But this feels so wrong. It is definitely the devil trying to steal my brain to do his evil will. My devices all hate me and have banded together and are conspiring to destroy my flesh and pee on my soul.

I must switch my major to computer science, because I spend like >half of my day breaking, troubleshooting, attempting to repair and breaking my systems all over again. 

As much as this experience sucks ass, it has actually been worthwhile because of the learning process involved.

One of these days, I'm gonna receive a Nobel prize for actually getting something done on my Windows 10 tablet. Yes, anything at all.

The iPad is almost as ruthless. If I could just somehow peer inside his mind, but for a few minutes, I can say I'd have a chance of comprehending his ways. But he is always hiding from me and I don't know the proper way to approach him about this issue. I just hate to see him suffering in such pain.

Sometimes I feel like I ought to just ask David Murney; but alas, it would be too easy... he'd tell me exactly what to do, and I'd be left with perfectly running hardware and software, and nothing to do except drink 14 more pots of coffee and think about impending doom.

#Windows10Tablet  #WaitWhyTheFuckWouldYouPutWindows10OnAnOversizedSmartphone #MostUselessPieceOfShitEver #MommyMyComputerWontLeaveMeAlone #ProbablyOughtToJailbreakSoon #WhyAmIMakingHashtags #IveNeverMadeHashtagsOnFacebookBefore #FuckThisShit

I've got the most awesome classes this Fall! It's imperative to be overwhelmingly excited about this.

I got kicked out of sex-ed, lol. So I picked the next sexiest course for the psych credit - personality. The professor is an instant winner! He hates going over the syllabus because doing a course while expecting to adhere excessively to a lesson plan stifles the spontaneous, inspiring atmosphere in which actual learning happens. 

Yes! We have a real teacher!

No reading. No homework. Just show up and learn about a few people's ideas about why people are so fucked up. There's an easy midterm and a final (both consisting of multiple choice and matching!) on which everyone usually does well.

And we get to take lots of personality tests!

The apartment that I was supposed to move into fell through, and I am so relieved! This is what I just responded to the management:

"Excellent. I was dreading having to live in a place run by such awful people for an entire year.

Thanks for wasting so much of my time and putting my family through hell.

Pieces of shit"

So, yeah... anybody need a roommate?
I'm back in Austin!

Well, it changed the way I felt about education entirely. Overnight, this little girl became my mentor, my inspiration. That was like 6 months ago, and I still think about her pretty much every day... Whenever I need to remind myself of the value of learning, and what we are able to achieve if we are truly passionate about life, and deeply aware of what incredible cognitive beings we are...

If we could only appreciate fully what a HUMAN BRAIN is....

We could be as cool as Stella Krone.

So I figured I had to finally buy an actual ipad to get my work done closer to reasonably efficiently, after going through so many cheap tablets that either end up breaking, or more often making me WANT to break them most of the time. 

Since I can only use one hand to type, a regular keyboard is not very useful, but a tablet with Swype  (aka swiftkey, gesture typing,  wordflow) is the perfect accommodation for me. I even tried a Windows 10 2-in-1 tablet PC...  turns out it's the only tablet for which there is absolutely NO WAY to input text other than the ridiculously terrible hunt-and-peck method... 

So I finally took the plunge last week  and got the cheapest actually decent apple... the ipad mini 2...

...and I already want to throw the thing out the window,  blow it up with firecrackers....

In many ways it's actually WORSE than the Windows tablet,  which was so bad it couldn't play videos at all, or even SONGS without constantly stuttering! All it was really useful for was typing on... without a method of text entry that works for me!

But... at least I could OPEN A FILE WITH A PROGRAM!

Maybe it just takes some time to learn ways around the walls that Apple puts around the most basic functions, making it so you can't do anything... as if your computer is not even really yours. I understand why it's called "jailbreak" (the ios version of rooting), which i should probablu do, but they just this week released a security update msking it harder, and id probabl end up brickibg the thing anyway...  if i dobt rnf up breaking it actially on purpose first... aplle people.... please help me out here.... how do you deal with these things? Do you just use other platforms to get around it?

Computers supposedly exist to servr us and make us more productivr . But it seems like I've become a slave to them, days go by just trying to troubleshoot a single issue, and all of a sudden I've become a full-time computer tech who gets no pay and no actual work done.

Note: I am not fixing typos today, because this is MATH DAY

Today I am studying for my math final, all day long. 

It may appear that I am wasting time on facebook making stupid posts, and that would make me a liar, but I assure you this is all part of a stupid mind game to increase my productivity, maybe somewhat paradoxically.

If you are reading this, at any point you are highly encouraged, urged, in fact, to ask me, publicly or privately, which topic I am on and to report my progress.

This will work to motivate me by turning my learning into a stupid game, and you have become my fans. I'm sure there's some stupid psychological concept at work here, like some stupid effect that happens when stupid athletes get egged on by a crowd. I don't care what that stupid thing is right now, because right now it's all about stupid math and you all being my cheerleaders.

Or, you could threaten me with awful torturous punishments that will introduce fear of pain and humiliation as an aspect of operant conditioning or something stupid like that.

I hope you noticed that I never called you stupid.

Current topic: Prime Factorization.
Progress:

Late-night study sesh, preparation for finals.

In psychology we learned the difference between intrinsic vs extrinsic motivation. It's pretty simple... It just means doing something because you enjoy it (intrinsic) vs doing it for some other reward, like money (extrinsic). But here's the weird part...

If a person is accustomed to doing something because they are intrinsically motivated to, and then an extrinsic reward is introduced....

According to studies, the intrinsic motivation tends to go away.

This might be the most frustrating and depressing aspect of human nature I have ever heard.

If you pursue your dreams, and become successful doing what you love...

Chances are...

I can't even bring myself to finish the sentence.

The tragic vision wins again.

Wait a minute...

I'm supposed to be studying math right now... My psych class ended 3 weeks ago!

data.post:
After having my nervous breakdown and dropping 2 of my classes, I went to see the academic counselor to face the consequences. Since I must complete at least 2/3 of the attempted credits to keep my funding, I was prepared for the worst. 

But I was hoping there was some other way. How could it be that my entire academic career is destroyed because I picked some bad classes?

"Don't worry so much about it"! The counselor told me. "We can smooth this over! It's your first year studying here, you can make up for it next term".

Then he helped me pick my fall classes, giving me some important advice. First of all, no more courses that cram it all into 5 weeks! It moves way too fast, and I didn't know any better. Then, he talked me out of taking government and history at all next term. Instead, he had me stick with subjects I'm good at to raise my GPA, so we settled on writing, philosophy and psychology, in addition to continuing with the ALEKS computerized math program that I love.

So here's what we settled with:

Monday/Wednesday: Math, English Composition
Tuesday/Thursday: Ethics, Human Sexuality

I'm not gonna accept any more friend requests without an accompanying message. There's like several a day that I have no idea who they are, and it's sketching me out because frankly, I'm not that cool that so many strangers should be wanting to connect for no reason. I'm gonna paste this into my info section, and if you don't see it you're out of luck... I'm not an asshole, I want to meet new people, all that I ask is that you tell me something... anything, to show that you're a real person. Thank you, that is all.

data.post:
I feel like I've learned more at school this summer than ever before in my entire life. But not from the classes. Not from the teachers, or about the subjects at all.  

I've been learning about myself. Learning about students, about teachers, learning about life... about work, about school... learning about learning. And about teaching. 

What makes a good teacher? A bad teacher? I want to say that there aren't any truly good or bad teachers, that it's really just a matter of preference; it's a question of chemistry. Which really means... communication. 

Every teacher is qualified and completely knowledgeable by default, or they wouldn't be there. But what separates a good teacher from a bad one is how they are able to communicate their knowledge. 

I had a nervous breakdown last week because of these 2 classes that I really didn't want to be taking in the first place. One was a course in US government, with one of the most awesome teachers I've ever had. The other was in American history, with possibly one of the worst teachers I've ever had.

Notice I used the word "was" when referring to the classes that were basically ruining my life, because I dropped them both.

Problem solved! 

Moral of the story: If something is giving you trouble in life... get rid of it and move on.

(Disclaimer: actual results may vary)

Anyway... the point of this post was supposed to, well, have a point. I was going to go into some deeply poetic, pseudo-intellectual diatribe about what makes a good or bad teacher. Because that's what I've had to figure out... since I just stated that I had in these 2 courses juxtaposed simultaneously one of the best and worst teachers, what is the criteria that I'm using for that judgment? 

Well... since I'm just rambling anyway, I'll start this thing with the greatest example of the BAD teacher. 

This is the way you should NOT teach your class:

[Teacher giving lecture... booooorrrriinnnggg]
. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
[Student politely interrupts to ask question, completely
relevant to the topic, honest request for clarification.]
. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
[Teacher has trouble answering the question, gets confused and frustrated, and proceeds to make the student feel ashamed for getting the lesson so far off track].

This is not the way to communicate knowledge. If all you are doing is giving a lecture by following a script, why are we even here? We might as well be watching a YouTube video, listening to a podcast, or reading a book.

You are not a teacher, you are a robot. 

Goodbye.

Associate Professor Casagranda, that wasn't you I was referring to. You're not that guy... you're the good teacher, we're cool!

You know why you're such an awesome teacher? Because you were always pausing to check in with us and ask,

"Are we cool"? . . . "Is that cool"?

Even though every time I really felt like screaming back, 

"Yes WE'RE cool! But no IT'S not cool! Because you're the cool teacher, but I'm gonna have to drop your class too, because you're just gonna end up an unfortunate casualty of my nervous breakdown, which was completely caused by the awful teacher, the other guy who is not cool."

So not cool....

EDIT:
Just need to conclude...

Don't be that guy. If you're a teacher....

BE A TEACHER!!!! NOT A ROBOT!

We could be anywhere in the world, with anyone at all... but we're here to learn from you. Please don't ever forget that!

Be like Associate Professor Casagranda. He is such a good teacher that I would often completely forget that I was even in class. 

The best teacher... is one who engages the students so deeply that they might not even realize that they are actually learning.

But we are indeed. 

Be like that guy.

Since some folks won't be able to make it tonight, it seems like we ought to follow this week's theme and postpone the Hebrew group 'till next week. Hope to see you all soon!

My psych instructor asked to speak to me after class regarding my final paper. So I was super anxious the whole time to find out what the deal is...

and she says...

That she hasn't given it a grade yet.

Apparently what I wrote was good, but WAY off from what was expected. So she hasn't figured out a grade yet.

I guess I broke the assignment.

âThe brevity of these silences is doubly astonishing when you consider that it takes at least 600 milliseconds for us to retrieve a single word from memory and get ready to actually say it. For a short clause, that processing time rises to 1500 milliseconds. This means that we have to start planning our responses in the middle of a partnerâs turn, using everything from grammatical cues to changes in pitch. We continuously predict what the rest of a sentence will contain, while similarly building our hypothetical rejoinder, all using largely overlapping neural circuits.â

data.post:
My brain is fried. I've been working on this for over 12 hours without stopping. Why? For heaven's sake, I'm in the first semester of community college, this isn't the time to pull off some wannabe grad student stunt... Tried to do way too much and ended up with a half assed, convoluted mess... I have 1 hour left till class, and I still have to revise and put in my references, but here's what I've got...

 if anyone would possibly be board enough to take a look and tell me if it makes any sense... you would be some kind of angel, or something ... because I have utterly exhausted any sense of verbal comprehension I might have had.
My paper for psychology on ADHD is due tomorrow... I've barely started it, because I keep getting distracted

I'm at... 
home. 

Where? I had lost all concept of such a place! I'm in utter shock... But this is for real! It was made possible by an incredibly generous anonymous donation... the final completing push to activate the entire pattern of the last 6 months... many different sections making up an entire community, all cooperating, working together to lift me up into a more productive, influential life.

I have so much to be thankful for, and countless people who have graced my path and placed in me their confidence... I have been taken off the street because people believe in me.

Therefore I must achieve my dreams... I'm carrying the investment of the whole community. Can't let them down! Nothing will stop me now!

They had more nerve fibers connecting auditory cortex, the part of the brain that processes sound, to their anterior insular cortex, a region involved in processing feelings. Learning about memory for psych class, and my brain just exploded... it seems that discovering the way memory works can do more to explain our nature than anything else.

Our memories make up who we are... our very perception of the world and how we relate to it only begins to make sense in our consciousness when it is compared and contrasted with our previous experience.

To explain more fully, sensory data comes into the brain, containing extremely detailed information describing the world around us. Way more information than we can process right now using all our equipment! 

So, what happens to all the rest of the information? 

It gets thrown away, because we don't know what it means, and can't use it. Unrecognized file format, no plug-in found...Because it has no reference in the long-term memory, it lacks the necessary software to decode it. This top-down signal from the long term memory actually accounts for half of our perception, our experience of the world around us.

That means that all the information coming from the senses that cannot be made sense of in light of our current understanding, never becomes encoded into our short term memory, it is immediately forgotten and we are never even aware that it was perceived at all.

So... is there any possible way to break out of this seemingly hopeless lack of awareness? What if we could somehow construct an alternate form of consciousness that would utilize the sensory input data without requiring a model in the long term memory? Or, create some kind of experiential âmaster keyâ with which to provide a âvirtual memoryâ loosely made to functionally correspond to the incoming data?

These are just a couple of highly speculative possibilities I am exploring right now. Let me ask a question- how do we explain our first experiences and memories? Is there some kind of pre-installed software consisting of a memory âstarter packâ upon which to build our consciousness? Or, is there some mechanism with which to âripâ incoming data on the fly, directly to the hard drive?

My suspicion is that it could cause overwhelming contradictions in our process of discerning reality from background noise or imagination, similar to the way an individual suffering from schizophrenia is interpreting signals as real that don't exist in reality. Could there be somewhere in our mental toolbox a âthresholdâ control, that could fine-tune which input is interpreted as real vs imaginary?

I tend to wonder if this could be the process that is mediated by and initiated through the activation of the 5-HT2a receptor in the human nervous system, which provides the mechanism for the psychedelic experience.

It was this very inquiry, attempting to discover how LSD works, that caused the cutting edge of brain science to advance into the identification of various serotonin receptors, all responsible for different forces of physical, intellectual, emotional and spiritual development. All psychedelic substances, whether ergoline (LSD âacidâ), tryptamine (mushrooms, DMT) or phenethylamine (mescaline, from cacti), act upon the 5-ht2a receptor to produce hallucinations and the various other changes to our awareness.

So what is the point of the trip? In other words, what use does this part of the brain serve to support healthy development, and what exactly is being developed?

It's removing/adjusting the filter, allowing sensory input to enter our consciousness, the stuff that we never had access to because we cannot understand it... all simply because we have never experienced it before. This creates the opportunity to redefine our perception of life and our understanding of our place in the universe, which retroactively defines our very sense of self, bringing us to a deeper, expanded concept of who we are. Through this we can break down the barriers between the senses and our perception to allow further development of this mental circuitry and gain access to a more complete representation of reality.

I've heard much of this stuff before from people who have experience with psychedelics, but now it actually makes sense! 

(Because it makes more SENSE...GET IT?)

Disclaimer: no illegal activity is admitted or encouraged. While the process of enlightenment facilitated by these receptors is part of our innate biology, consuming substances to artificially activate them is not. Perhaps they can be activated through our own conscious will and experience... But this, my enlightened friends, is an entirely different post...

Happy experiencing! Believe in and achieve your dreams! Don't let the parasitic memories bite!

Teetering on the edge of confirming the purported destiny actualization potential of our spectacularly gracious host and friendâs providential preparation...
The gloriously harmonious ensemble of cosmic unfathomably significant networking serendipity...
Longing in desperation for the vast lagoon of delight in the impeccable timing and teleologically self-determining trajectory of the will of the One who resides at His right hand on high...
As the deer yearns for springs of water, so my soul experiences an as-of-yet unfulfilled, cosmic-scaled lightning-like impulse to bridge a chasm of uncertainty with which she has suddenly presented herself...

Behold now, my quandary:

There was a guy there last night who I am not seeing on the guest list, and I am about to throw a tantrum, because it is absolutely imperative that I find him!

God.... where do I even start? And why, oh why Lord, did I not take the initiative to express this profound connection while the opportunity was there?

To my beloved mystery man who helped me find faith, salvation and rebirth as a believer:

I don't remember your name but I met you in the prayer tent at Rez Week, and you were at David's last night. I don't think I even talked to you, but you have done more than anyone could imagine to present me with eternal life.

May it be the Lord's will that someone can figure this out.

Until then, I'll be crying my eyes out like the miserable little stubborn baby I am.

data.post:
This song goes back to high school, when I recorded a totally cheesy pop tune that sounded kinda like Hanson, which would have had marginal artistic value by virtue of parody, had I not tried to give it some edge with obnoxious metal screams through the chorus. Hanson + Korn = not even funny. 

So the song suffered from debilitating depression due to extreme identity crisis, finding relief only through self-harm, when it decided to switch into a minor key (since it was pretty much the only song of mine that was not), and oh....

Wow. Minor key me likey SO moar bettR. Suddenly the melody is speaking from its soul!

I made this with Ableton Live for Electronic Music class a couple years ago, and it's still one of my favorites because it's so dark, grindy and tedious sounding, like bang-your-head-with-a-hammer  Adagio in A minor.

The class was speechless and a bit frightened, which means my goal was achieved. Finally the instructor broke the silence by saying:

âWell... sorry, just kinda blown away. This is the music we'll be listening to a thousand years from now. We're not quite ready for this yet.â

Story of my life....!

data.post:
Did my psychology paper on the effects of synthetic cannabinoids on the brain. Got an A on the first test! It's mostly stuff that I was already learning on my own, just for fun... The topic is endlessly fascinating to me in the most relevant way I can imagine. Brain science. Neurotransmitters. Consciousness. It's what we are. It's the most logical starting point when I ask, âwhat's going on here?â! Descartes said âI am a thinking thingâ, but what is doing the thinking? Something like 86 billion neurons....

In modern Hebrew a computer is called a âmaá¸¥sheá¸â, a âthinking thingâ. It's my favorite word that was coined in Israel. Central Processing Unit. The first computers, though, were in fact people. The digital silicon-based ones are vastly more efficient at accurately storing and recalling information, but the meaty brain is way way WAY more specialer...more unique...  Unfathomably powerful, but in its own weird, quirky way... weaving our perception into a story in real time, producing self-awareness.

Now the internet... that's totally a giant brain, that we are all constantly building together. It's dynamic, flexible, diverse, made of specialized parts that communicate with each other in myriad ways... Presenting to the subjective user a phenomenology that is constantly fluttering somewhere between painfully boring and utterly terrifying, churning up copious quantities of the unimaginable while often coming up curiously vacant of whatever you happen to be obsessively seeking.

The day will likely come when our brains of flesh will have thought our last. That's when I hope to move into the cloud... and just live in the internet! Maybe that's what heaven will be. I can compose electronic music and blog for the rest of eternity, putting cartoons on YouTube and teaching classes to pay for my software and bandwidth.

Speaking of which, tonight at 6pm I'll be having a study group at 2202 Nueces. It's free, all are welcome! If youâre outside of Austin maybe you could join us on video chat... otherwise, why not stop on down and sing and color with us, while we still together can meet as meat.
Got a legit teaching gig!
Looking for a room to rent in Austin, for part or all of the Summer, to move into asap. Any leads appreciated!

This is the first math course that has ever worked for me, because the software knows when youâre ready to move on, instead of having a teacher assign you 100 versions of the same stupid problem. And itâs in the biggest computer lab in the whole country!

âThis is not normal student behaviorâ. -campus police

Yes.... School is going great

Reb Zalman's Psalm translations:

{file "Psalm 6" "Psalm6.xml"}

{poetry}
/6:1 A David Song 
(Note to the Conductor -- play this melody on the eight stringer)
/6:2 Yah! Please don't chide me 
in Your anger. 
Don't scold me in Your wrath.
/6:3 I need You to show me kindness. 
I am so miserable. 
Heal me, Yah! My bones ache so.
/6:4 My inner self is very troubled. 
I ask You, Yah! 
How long must I still endure?
/6:5 Relent, Yah, 
And for mercy's sake 
Pull me out and spare me.
/6:6 How can I remember You 
If I am dead in the pits? 
Who will thank You?
/6:7 I groan and am all worn out. 
I sob on my bed; 
My tears drench my mattress.
/6:8 My eyes are stinging 
From frustration, 
As if all my troubles 
Wept them out.

/6:9 Away with you, 
All you traffickers of sin!
/6:10 Yah has heard my wailing. 
Yah has listened to my pleading. 
Yah will fulfill my prayer.
/6:11 Confusion and embarrassment 
On you, you fiends! 
This very moment, Let shame 
Bring you to your senses.
{prose}

{file "Psalm 15" "Psalm15.xml"}

{poetry}
/15:1 David's song: 

Yah! 
Who may be at home in Your tent? 
Who may find sanctuary 
On Your Sacred mountain?

/15:2 One who strides with wholeness, 
Acts with fairness, 
Whose heart and words 
Speak with honesty, 
/15:3 Not given to gossip, 
Not hurting others, 
Not shifting blame on others.
/15:4 Wary of his own motives, 

He honors those 
Who are respectful of God. 
She will not stoop to lie 
When she swears, 
Even if it causes her loss.
/15:5 He lends his money, interest free, 
Won't accept a bribe, 
To convict the innocent.
One who acts in this way, 
Will never waver.
{prose}

{file "Psalm 24" "Psalm24.xml"}

/24:1 David's song (for opening himself to Spirit).

{fn. a This psalm was the Sunday song of the Levites in the Holy Temple.}

{poetry}
Earth and her fullness 
Are Yours, Yah, 
The cosmos and its beings.
/24:2 You founded Earth 
On the endless seas of space.
You set her by the streams 
Of the great Flow.

/24:3 Who can rise 
To Your summit, Yah? 
Who can stand 
In Your place of holiness?
/24:4 One who has hands 
that are clean, 
A heart that is pure, 
Who has no false oath 
On her conscience, 
Who swore not to larceny.
/24:5 Such a one 
Will raise a blessing from You, Yah, 
Kind generosity from You, 
Her helpful God.

/24:6 Such people are of a generation 
That seeks You. 
Like Jacob seeking to face You, 
Selah!

/24:7 Open your minds' imagination! 
Let the Gates to eternity 
Come into view!
Then the King of Glory 
Will appear.
/24:8 Who is this, 
the King of Glory?
Yah â Tzebaot, 
She is the Queen of Glory. 
Yah! Powerful and strong. 
Yah, the ever victorious!

/24:9 Open your minds' imagination! 
Let the Gates to eternity 
Come into view, 
And then the King of Glory 
Will appear.
/24:10 Who is this, the King of Glory?
Yah â Tzebaot, 
She is the Queen of Glory. 
Selah!
{prose}

{file "Psalm 27" "Psalm27.xml"}

{poetry}
/27:1 Yah, you are my Light, my Savior, 
Whom need I dread?
Yah, With You as my strong Protector 
Who can make me panic?
/27:2 When hateful bullies gang up on me, 
Wanting to harass me, 
To oppress and terrorize me, 
They are the ones who stumble and fall.
/27:3 Even if a gang surrounds me 
My heart is not weakened.
If a battle is joined around me 
My trust in You is firm.
/27:4 Only one thing do I ask of You, Yah, 
Just this alone do I seek: 
I want to be at home with You, Yah, 
All the days of my life.
I want to delight in seeing You, 
When I come to visit You in Your Temple.
/27:5 You hide me in Your Succah on an foul day.
You conceal me unseen in Your tent 
And also raise me beyond anyone's reach.
/27:6 And now, as You have held my head high, 
Despite the presence of my powerful foes, 
I prepare to celebrate and thrill, 
Singing and making music to You, Yah!
/27:7 Listen, Yah, to the sound of my cry 
And, being kind, answer me.
/27:8 My heart has said: `I turn to seek You, 
Your Presence is what I beg for.'
/27:9 Don't hide Your Face from me. 
Don't just put me down, 
You, who have been my helper 
Don't abandon me, don't forsake me, 
God, my support.
/27:10 Though father and mother have left me 
You, Yah, will hold me securely.
/27:11 Please teach me Your way 
And guide me on the straight path. 
Discourage those who defame me.
/27:12 False witnesses stood up against me, 
Belching out violence. 
Don't let me become the victim of my foes.
/27:13 (I would not have survived)
If I had not hoped that I would yet see 
Yah's goodness fully alive on Earth.
/27:14 So friend, you too, hope to Yah. 
Be sturdy! 
And make strong your heart! 
And most of all ---keep hoping to Yah.
{prose}

{file "Psalm 30" "Psalm30.xml"}
{poetry}
/30:1 A Psalm for A Housewarming, 
Composed by David

/30:2 I acclaim You, my God. 
You set me free 
So that my foes 
Could not gloat at my troubles.
/30:3 Yah, my God, I pleaded with You. 
You healed me.
/30:4 Yah, you lifted me from the pit; 
From the brink of the grave 
You brought me back to Life.

/30:5 Fellow devotees! 
Join me in my song. 
Remembering what is sacred, 
Let's give thanks.

/30:6 For a moment, I felt You angry, 
Then I felt Life and acceptance.
Though weeping as I fell asleep, 
I woke up singing.
/30:8 You, Yah, made my mountain firm, 
I thought I was safe; 
That I won't ever stumble.
But when You hid 
your Face from me, 
I panicked.
/30:9 I call to You, Yah! 
I plead with You, Adonai!
/30:10 What use is there in my death 
To go down to ruin?
Can dust appreciate You? 
Can it discern Your Truth?
/30:11 Listen, Yah! 
Be kind to me! 
Yah, Please help me.

/30:12 You turned my grieving 
Into a dance of reconciliation. 
You took off my rags 
And wrapped me in joy.
/30:13 Now, Your Glory is my song. 
I won't hold back.
Yah, my God, 
I will ever be grateful!
{prose}

{file "Psalm 48" "Psalm48.xml"}

{fn. b This psalm was the Monday song of the Levites in the Holy Temple.}

{poetry}
/48:1 Song and music from the Korachites
/48:2 Here in God's city, 
On this holy mountain, 
God is vast and His fame is glorious.
/48:3 This beautiful landscape, 
The joy place of Earth, 
Mount Zion 
at Jerusalem's North side, 
The great royal capital.

/48:4 In her palaces, 
God is known in exaltation.
/48:5 Here, kings gathered. 
They came together.
/48:6(If they came as enemies...) 
They saw and were overwhelmed 
With awe. 
They were shaken and took flight.
/48:7 Trembling, they shook, 
Shaking like a woman in labor.

/48:8 A storm You raised from the East, 
Shattering Tarshish cruisers.
/48:9 All this we heard.
We even saw it all, 
In God's city, 
The Seat of Yah-Tzebaot.
May God keep it flourishing forever. 
Selah!

/48:10 In the midst of Your Temple, 
We looked for Your Grace, O God.
/48:11 Your reputation is well deserved. 
So, we praise You 
To the ends of the Earth.
Fairness and kindness 
Issue from Your right hand.
/48:12 Zion's mountain rejoices. 
Judah daughters are gleeful. 
All because of how You act justly.

/48:13 Go round Zion, enfold her. 
Take note of her towers.
/48:14 Set your heart on her strengths. 
Raise her mansions high. 
Then, you will tell about it 
To generations yet to come:

/48:15 This is God, our God! 
Forever and ever. 
He will guide us past death.
{prose}

{file "Psalm 67" "Psalm67.xml"}

{poetry}
/67:1 A Psalm for all the peoples 
of the planet

/67:2 God, bless us with grace! 
Let Your loving Face shine on us!
/67:3 We want to get to know Your way 
Here on Earth, 
Seeing how Your help is given 
To every group of people.
/67:4 Oh, how the various peoples 
Will thank You, 
All of them will sing 
And be grateful.
/67:5 Many people will be joyous 
And sing 
When You, Will set them right 
With forthrightness. 
And the peoples, 
As You direct them, 
Will cheer You.
/67:6 Oh, how the various peoples 
Will thank You. 
All of them will sing, be grateful.
/67:7 The Earth will give her harvest. 
Such blessings come from God. 
Yes, from our God!
/67:8 Bless us God, 
All the ends of the Earth 
Will esteem You!
{prose}

{file "Psalm 81" "Psalm81.xml"}

{fn. c This psalm was the Thursday song of the Levites in the Holy Temple.}

/81:1 (Accompany this Assaph song with the guitar)
/81:2 Make music to God, 
The Source of our strength.
/81:3 Trumpet a fanfare to Jacob's God: 
Louder, Drum rolls, 
Sweet sounding violins 
And pipes.
/81:4 Greet the New Moon 
With the Shofar, The time 
When the moon is hidden, 
And still we celebrate.

/81:5 This is the imperative for Israel. 
To become prepared, 
For being judged by Jacob's God.
/81:6 (Like that day when...) 
Joseph was empowered 
To go out and rule Egypt, 
Able to understand a language 
He never learned.
/81:7 (This caused that, in the end.) 
The heavy load 
was taken from his back 
No longer 
having to knead the clay.
/81:8 You called when oppressed, 
And I (said God) freed you.

In the thunder 
You heard my secret message. 
Later, I tested you 
at Meribah's springs. 
Selah!

/81:9 Listen my people! 
I witness this to you! 
Israel, if only 
you would listen to Me.

/81:10 Don't cling to a strange god. 
Don't worship an alien deity.

/81:11 It is I, Yah, 
Who took you up from Egypt.
I fed you 
and you were sated to fullness.
/81:12 But My people did not obey me. 
Israel did not desire Me close.
/81:13 I let them have their hearts' way, 
To pursue their own devices.

/81:14 Oy! 
If only my people would obey Me, 
Israel would walk in My ways.
/81:15 In a moment, 
I would subdue their foes. 
I would, with My own hands, 
repay them.
/81:16 Those who loathe Yah, but deny it, 
Will have their rebuke forever.
/81:17 (But you who obey...) 
I will feed with the fat of grain. 
And satisfy 
With honey from the rock.
{prose}

{file "Psalm 82" "Psalm82.xml"}

{fn. d This psalm was the Tuesday song of the Levites in the Holy Temple.}

/82:1 Assaph sings: 
God is present 
to the godly gathering. 
He presides among those 
Who administer judgment, 
(and warns them), 
/82:2 `How much longer will you twist 
Your verdicts 
and favor the wicked?' 
Selah!
/82:3 In your judging, 
Consider the modest, 
the orphan. 
Find justice for the destitute 
And the oppressed.
/82:4 Assist the poor, the down and out. 
Save them from the bullies' hands.

/82:5 Not knowing, unawares you are, 
You walk in the dark, 
While the foundations of earth 
Are toppling.

/82:6 I set you to be judges, 
To be like angels 
of the Most High.
/82:7 But you will die like anyone else, 
Topple like demoted princes.
/82:8 Arise, O God! 
Bring justice to the world! 

You can bring order 
to all the nations.
{prose}

{file "Psalm 93" "Psalm93.xml"}

{fn. e This psalm was the Friday song of the Levites in the Holy Temple.}

{poetry}
/93:1 Yah, You ruled, robed in dignity.
Donning intensity, 
Girded with strength, 
Even the cosmos you arrayed 
That it not falter.
/93:2 Your Throne 
Is prepared from the farthest past. 
You have been before 
There was a world.

/93:3 The currents raise their roar, 
The rivers raise the spumes, 
The mighty torrents' thunder.
/93:4 The thunder of the ocean's breakers: All exclaim, 
`Most powerful are You, Yah!' 
Oh, Yah! /93:5  Your creation 
witnesses You well. 
Of sacred beauty is Your house-- 
Through all of time.
{prose}

{file "Psalm 94" "Psalm94.xml"}

{fn. f This psalm was the Wednesday song of the Levites in the Holy Temple.}

{poetry}
/94:1 God who settles scores! 
Appear in Divine vengeance!
/94:2 Make Yourself known, 
As The Judge of the World. 

Let the arrogant suffer 
Your retribution.

/94:3 How long yet YHVH 
will the wicked -- 
How long yet 
will the evil ones prosper?
/94:4 Boasting their malice, 
They talk each other into greater evil.
/94:5 YHVH! 
They oppress Your people. 
They demean Your legacy.
/94:6 They murder widows 
and strangers. 
They kill orphans!

/94:7 Deluded are they, 
Thinking that Yah cannot see, 
The God of Jacob is not aware.
/94:8 Boorish trash! 
Try to make sense! 
Fools, will you ever get wise?
/94:9 The One who plants ears -- 
Can He not hear? 
Who shapes eyes -- 
Can She not see?
/94:10 He who reproaches nations -- 
Does She not call them to task? 

He, Who teaches people 
to be aware, Is She not aware?

/94:11 YHVH, 
Knows our human thoughts. 
They are all worthless.
/94:12 Blissful is the one 
whom You, Yah, 
Take to task and teach him 
Of Your Torah, 
/94:13 To keep him secure 
during evil days, 
Tiding him over until ruin 
Overtakes the wicked.
/94:14 Because YHVH, 
Will not forsake His people. 
She will not abandon Her heritage.
/94:15 Justice will return to the courts, 
Vindicating those of upright heart.
/94:16 Will anyone 
Stand with me against the wicked? 
Who will stand up for me 
Against the bullies?

/94:17 Had YHVH not helped me, 
I would not have escaped 
The silent tomb.
/94:18 When my knees buckled, 
Your Grace, YHVH, 
Held me up.
/94:19 When overwhelmed 
By disturbing thoughts--like... 
`How could You assist malice?' 
I found comfort 
As You delighted my soul.
/94:20 Those who scoff 
all laws and justice, 
/94:21 Who band together 
Against righteous souls, 
And shed pure blood in meanness, 
/94:23 You paid them back 
for their crimes.
YHVH, God, 
You suppressed them for their evil.
/94:22 YHVH, Is at all times 
my tower of strength, 
My God, The rock of my safe place.
{prose}

{file "Psalm 100" "Psalm100.xml"}

{poetry}
/100:1 This is how you sing to God 
A Thank You song. 
You join the symphony 
Of the whole Earth.
/100:2 In your gratefulness, 
You meet Him. 
Voices echo joy in God's halls.

/100:3 In giving thanks, 
We engage Her blessings. 
We meet His goodness, 
Here and now; 
Her encouragement 
From generation to generation. 

You are filled with joy 
Serving God's purpose. 
You sound your own song 
As you do it. 
Certain that God is Be-ing, 
We know that we are 
Brought forth from Her, 
--Both God's companions 
And His flock.
/100:4 Enter into God's Presence 
Singing your own song, 
In grateful appreciation. 

Thank You God, You are all Blessing.
/100:5 In this world, You are goodness. 
Yes, Grace, itself. 
This is the trust we bequeath 
The next generation.
{prose}

{file "Psalm 104" "Psalm104.xml"}

{poetry}
/104:1 Bless YAH, breath of mine. 
YAH, my God, You are so vast and great, 
All veiled in pride and glory!

/104:2 You are wrapped in Light. 
The sky, You spread like a sheet.

/104:3 Your upper chambers are water roofed, 
As You bestride clouds. 
You waft on the wings of wind.

/104:4 The breezes, You send 
are Your aides, 
Your helpers, blazing flames.

/104:5 You founded Earth, so sound, 
To outlast time itself.

/104:6 The abyss, You covered like a mantle 
Water! On mountains rests.

/104:7 You sound a roar and they flee. 
Your thunder makes them shake.

/104:8 Mountains high and valleys low... 
Their places they assume.

/104:9 You set them limits they cannot pass. 
Never again to flood the land.

/104:10 Springs flow into brooks 
And snake between the mountains.

/104:11 All the wild of field drink there. 
The beasts slake there their thirst.

/104:12 By their shores dwell birds that soar, 
Sounding calls through leaves and reeds.

/104:13 You drench the hills 
From Your Upper Chambers. 

From your hands' produce 
The Earth is filled.

/104:14 You grow fodder for the tamed beasts, 
And herbs with human labor, 

To bring forth bread from Earth.
/104:15 And wine to delight the sad ones, 

And oil... that softens skin, 
And bread... that sustains the weak.

/104:16 Even the trees you sate with sap. 
The cedars You planted on the Lebanon.

/104:17 There, birds find their nesting. 
There, storks find homes to rest.

/104:18 Antelopes bound on the heights. 
Marmots hide behind rocks.

/104:19 The Moon pulls tides and seasons. 
The sun knows where to set.

/104:20 You darken dusk to night. 
The forest's night life stirs.

/104:21 The big cats cry for prey, 
Praying God for their food.

/104:22 They return at the rising of the sun, 
To crouch once more in lairs.

/104:23 While humans go out to work, 
To their toil, up to night.

/104:24 How many things You do! 
So wisely are they made. 
All Earth, at Your command.

/104:25 This vast sea beyond all grasp. 
Countless are the creatures in her, 
Tiny ones and giant whales.

/104:26 There go stately ships. 
This Leviathan You shaped 
To play and romp therein.

/104:27 They all rely on Your care, 
To feed them well each time.

/104:28 You give to them and they take it. 
Your hand's gifts sate them well.

/104:29 You hide your face, they panic. 
You recall their breaths, they die. 
They return to their dust.

/104:30 You send your spirit, 
And they are re-created. 
So too, You renew life on Earth.

/104:31 Let Your glory, Yah, fill time and space. 
Take Joy, O Yah, in what You do!

/104:32 You look at Earth and she trembles, 
Hills You touch, and they smoke.

/104:33 I live Your song, my Yah, 
My Yah, I am Your tune.

/104:34 Let my talking give You joy. 
I am so happy, my Yah!

/104:35 I wish no sin exist on Earth. 
All wickedness were gone. 

Bless that Yah, my soul, my breath.

HALLELU-YAH!
{prose}

{file "Psalm 139" "Psalm139.xml"}

{poetry}
/139:1 Conductor - David's prayer set to music.
Yah! You have scanned me 
And discerned me.
/139:2 You know when I am relaxed 
or agitated. 
From afar 
You comprehend my fantasies.
/139:3 You design my conduct and my repose. 
You direct my paths so I can manage.

/139:4 Before my mouth opens 
You know what I am about to say.
/139:5 You have shaped my past and my future. 
Your hand, gently on my shoulder.

/139:6 All this awes my awareness. 
It is beyond my skills to fathom.

/139:7 Whereto can I withdraw from Your spirit? 
Flee from facing You?

/139:8 If I would mount up to Heaven 
There are You. 
If I make my bed in Hell 
You are there too.

/139:9 Soaring on the wings of the dawn, 
To find shelter in the setting sun, 
/139:10 It would be Your hand, 
that would carry me, 
Your right hand, holding me safe.

/139:11 If I want to find oblivion in darkness, 
Trading light for darkness, 
/139:12 To You, it would still not be dark.
Night is as bright as day for You. 
Dark and light - the same in Your sight.
/139:13 You have designed my innards, 
shaped me in the my mother's womb.
/139:14 I am overcome with thanks 
At Your awesome wonders, 
Your astonishing works, 
Of which my soul is aware.
/139:15 My essence is not hidden from You, 
Who have made me in concealment, 
Who has knitted me beneath the surface.

/139:16 Your eyes have seen me as embryo. 
My days--are all inscribed 
in Your ledger-- 
Days not yet shaped -
each one of them counted.

/139:17 How precious are Your stirrings 
in me Oh God! 
How powerful their impact!
/139:18 I can't number them -- 
beyond all sand grains. 
When I emerge from my reflection 
I am still with You.

/139:19 If You, God, would only rid us 
from our evil! 
If only the cruelty would disappear!
/139:20 And defiance of You vanish, 
Forgiveness overtaking enmity!

/139:21 I detest hatred of You - Yah! 
Quarrelsomeness repels me.
/139:22 I loathe hostility to the utmost.

/139:23 God! I open myself to Your scrutiny. 
Know what is in my heart. 
Examine and know my longings.
/139:24 See and remove any defiance from me 
And guide me in the way 
that serves Your intent for our Earth.
{prose}

{file "Psalm 145" "Psalm145.xml"}

{poetry}
/145:1 David's Aleph Bet Praise

I hold You in the highest esteem, 
My God, My King. 
In all I do, 
I will offer praise to You.

/145:2 Every day, 
I will offer You my appreciation 
And I will cheer You, 
In all that I do.

/145:3 Magnificent are You, Yah, 
And much appreciated. 
But, Your true greatness 
Is beyond knowing.

/145:4 One generation 
Transmits its excitement 
To the next 
Over Your amazing actions, 
Telling them of Your might.
/145:5 Splendid and glorious 
Is Your fame. 

In all that I do, 
I delight to tell of Your marvels.

/145:6 While others may speak 
Of Your awesome power, 
I stress Your great kindness.

/145:7 Many will recall 
Your great goodness, 
And sing of Your fairness.

/145:8 You, Yah, are gentle 
And compassionate, 
Most patient 
And caring.

/145:9 You, Yah, are good to all of us. 
All that You have made, 
You hold in Your tenderness.

/145:10 We, who are fashioned by You, 
Acclaim You. 
In fervent devoutness, 
We bless You.

/145:11 We talk of the honor 
Of Your realm, 
And draw our energy 
From Your power.

/145:12 Thus, we announce to others 
How powerful You are, 
And how distinguished 
Your Majesty is.

/145:13 Your domain embraces universes. 
Your authority is recognized 
Throughout all generations.

/145:14 You, Yah, 
Keep us from faltering, 
And help us up, when we stumble.

/145:15 We all look up to You with hope. 
And trust that You will provide us, 
At the right moment, 
With what we need.

/145:16 You open Your hand, 
And each one of us receives, 
What we desire.

/145:17 You are a Tzaddik, 
In all Your ways; 
A Chassid, 
In all that You do.

/145:18 You are close by 
When we call on You; 
Especially, when we fully mean it.

/145:19 You shape the will of those 
Who respect You; 
You hear their pleading, 
And, You help.

/145:20 You, Yah, protect those 
Who love You. 
Those who do evil, 
You eliminate.

/145:21 I offer my mouth to God's praise. 
Let all who are 
in bodies of flesh, 
Bless Your holy Name at all times, 
And we will bless You, Yah, 
From now on, and for as long 
As there is life, on this world.
{prose}

{file "Psalm 146" "Psalm146.xml"}

{poetry}
/146:1 Halleluyah!
Spirit of mine, praise Yah!
/146:2 I will indeed praise Yah, 
With my life. 
I will sing to God, 
With all my being.
/146:3 I will not put my reliance in big shots. 
What can people do, 
Who can't even help themselves?
/146:4 When their spirits leave them, 
They return to their dust. 
All their schemes have vanished.
/146:5 Happy is one, 
Who is helped by Jacob's God; 
Whose hope is entrusted in Yah, His God--The One, 
/146:6 Who makes heaven and earth, 
The ocean and all that lives there.
He is also the One, who is forever. 
The standard of truth and sincerity.
/146:7 He seeks justice for the oppressed, 
And gives food to the starved. 
Yah, is the One, 
Who frees the imprisoned.
/146:8 Yah, gives sight to the blind. 
Yah, upholds the stooping. 
Yah, loves the Tzaddikim.
/146:9 Yah, protects the converts, 
consoles the orphaned 
and the widowed, 
Confounds the way 
Of the malicious.

/146:10 Please, Yah! Zion's God! 
Manifest Your rule in the world! 
For us, and for our children.
Halleluyah
{prose}

{file "Psalm 147" "Psalm147.xml"}

{poetry}
/147:1 Halleluyah!
It is so good to sing to our God 
Make good music 
to accompany the words 
/147:2 Yah, Builds Jerusalem 
by gathering 
Her scattered Godwrestlers.
/147:3 He makes the broken hearted well, 
And soothes the hurt 
Of their bruises.
/147:4 Counting the stars 
And naming them, 
He creates them each to be.
/147:5 Great, is our Master, 
And powerful beyond measure. 
No one can describe 
His way of comprehension.

/147:6 Yah, encourages the downtrodden, 
But the insolent, He brings low.

/147:7 Offer gratitude to Yah! 
To the harp, 
Sing songs of celebration 
To our God 
/147:8 He covers the sky 
With billowing clouds: 
Thus arranging rain for the ground, 
Making the hills sprout forth grass.

/147:9 Giving the beasts the food 
They need; 
Even to the young ravens, 
Who cry to be fed.
/147:10 He is not impressed 
By a stallion's feistiness; 
Nor, by the muscles 
Of a man's thighs.
/147:11 Yah, welcomes those 
Who respect Him; 
Who long for His grace.
/147:12 Jerusalem! Zion! 
Give praise to Yah. 
Celebrate that He is your God!

/147:13 Because He strengthened 
The bars of your gates, 
And blessed your children 
/147:14 In your midst, 
Your borders He set to hold peace 
And satisfies you 
With good nourishment.
/147:15 When He decrees 
Something for Earth, 
His command is swiftly fulfilled.

/147:16 Snow, like white wool, 
He sends down. 
Frost, He scatters like sand.
/147:17 He sends hail, like crumbs. 
No one can stand it when 
He brings on the cold.
/147:18 Sending His word, He melts them, 
Blowing warm wind 
And the waters flow.

/147:19 He imparts His words to Jacob; 
His statutes and judgments 
To Israel. 

Alas!
/147:20 He did not do the same 
For other nations. His judgments, 
He did not share with them.
Halleluyah!
{prose}

{file "Psalm 148" "Psalm148.xml"}

{poetry}
/148:1 Halleluyah!
Applaud and cheer Yah, 
From the heavens.

/148:2 Praise Him, the most sublime! 
Angel assembly, sing Hallel! 
Heaven hosts, sing Hallel!
/148:3 Hallel, too, sun and moon. 
Hallel, also, stars of light!
/148:4 Jubilation 
From the heavens of heavens. 
From the streams of endless space, 
He has decreed your existence.
/148:5 Praise God and be grateful for life.
/148:6 He fortified you to last long; 
Set a directive, 
That cannot be disobeyed.
/148:7 Hallel, too, from earth, 
From dragons and deep canyons.
/148:8 Fire, hail, snow and fog, 
Tempests and storms 
Obeying His word.
/148:9 Mountains, Hallel! 
And hills echo. 
Fruit trees and cedars 
Sway their praise.
/148:10 Wild and tame creatures, 
Creepers and winged birds.
/148:11 Hallel, too, from you -- 
Rulers of lands and nations, 
Officials and judges of the land.

/148:12 Lads and also lasses, Hallel! 
Elders together with youths.

/148:13 All of you, praise Yah's Name. 
His very Name, is so transcendent.

His glory is reflected 
By Heaven and Earth.
/148:14 Grand is the fate of His people. 
His devout ones, 
In constant adoration.
Halleluyah those intimate and close to Him, 
You Children of Israel, Halleluyah.
{prose}

{file "Psalm 149" "Psalm149.xml"}

{poetry}
/149:1 Halleluyah!
Sing a brand new song to Yah. 
This, is how He is celebrated 
Among the Chassidim.
/149:2 Yisrael, is happy 
Knowing his Maker. 
Zion's children, 
Delight in their King.
/149:3 Dancing, they chant His Name, 
Making rhythm, 
With drums and strings.
/149:4 Yah, loves His people. 
The self-effacing, 
Can count on Him for help.
/149:5 Chassidim, savor 
His awesome Presence. 
Even on their bed, They hum His praises.
/149:6 They exalt God, in inner speech. 
Such praise is a potent weapon, 
/149:7 Repelling antagonists, 
Scolding bigots, 
/149:8 To immobilize their commanders, 
And arrest their agitators.

/149:9 Rebuke them, as they deserve! 

All this, because God's Chassidim 
Gives honor to Him in splendor.
Halleluyah!
{prose}

{file "Psalm 150" "Psalm150.xml"}

{poetry}
/150:1 Halleluyah. Attune to God in holiness: 
be in awe of God who is mighty 
in the heavens.
/150:2 mark God for His potent acts: 
praise God for Her generosity.
/150:3 Salute God with trumpet sound: 
hail God with the strings and harp.
/150:4 Worship God with drum and dance: 
Intone to God with organ and flute.

/150:5 Make rhythm to God with crashing cymbals: 
praise God with cymbals that ring out.
/150:6 Let all who breathe chant Yah.
Halleluyah.
{prose}

data.post:
Austin Taylor declared the Hebrew study group *SOLD* when it was announced that it would involve coloring! We now present our cast of characters! Hardly any people have seen this animation, I only know about it because I lived with the guy who created it, in Safed, Israel where we were studying and playing music together. He has such a deep passion for cartoons - he talked about his background in animation school during our mystical philosophy lesson, comparing the concept of shading to the way God's light shines in the world, and I was blown away by how much sense he made while comparing deep Hasidic theological concepts to art! Then when he showed me this, I was blown away again by how much personality he managed to put into the letters, which is exactly how we need to learn them, by bringing them to life and making them real to us. He got the Rabbi's kids to do the voices!

I just now had a great idea that we can do together - We can go through the words in this story to learn the letters (and some great words that include them), and then we'll make our own version with words from the Gospel! It will serve as a model for learning Hebrew in a Christian context, and maybe we could even make our own video eventually!?!

data.post: This was when I moved to Israel. Before I left I was so excited not to have to hear all the same crap on the radio. Yes, it was quite a surprise... It's pretty much the same everywhere. The dream of finding somewhere totally "exotic" was not fulfilled, but was rather misguided - you have to LOVE the cheesy pop songs, they are annoyingly infectious because they are well made, kinda like fast food and other mind-altering substances, pornography, and anything designed to mimic authentic stimulation. However, if you carry the logic out further, you'll find that nearly everything is an artificial form of something that works by exploiting our brain-goodies. Music itself, some say, is merely auditory cheesecake. And cheesecake is really really good!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4YpBnGrcSR8

data.post: This was 4 years ago, when I lived in Eugene, Oregon! That's when I bought a ukulele and started my @[606539822826740:274:GrungeBob PukeyPants] YouTube channel to parody the fad of people doing ironic ukulele covers, and my shtick was to pick songs and utterly demolish them. But for this video, I decided to break that pattern by playing the song super-cereally for once. The response was pretty good! Shoutout to @[27907181:2048:Bryan H.] and @[15714211:2048:Casey Houlihan], miss you guys!
Can't miss this! I'm told it is a PHENOMENON!

Update on my campaign to get back into school: 

A local church has agreed to take care of the balance!

Hi everyone! As I've been talking to and getting to know you, lots of you have mentioned that you are interested in learning Hebrew, or that you have been trying to but aren't getting very far very fast. I want to fix that by starting a weekly study session where we will make it super fun and inspiring using the traditions that I was a part of in New York, Oregon and Israel over the past 10 years. We can also go through RVL's material as part of the course, and it will include deep examination of the prophecies that were fulfilled through Jesus, such as the songs of the Suffering Servant in the book of Isaiah. And singing too! Let's see who may be interested by discussing it here or in person, or both, and we'll figure out more details! God bless!

Tonight's featured track from my electronic album. It's gotten the most positive feedback from friends like you, and I've also got some big plans for it! The song absolutely nails the whole concept of a love tragedy, so I decided to use it as the central motif in my opera, which I've been planning to write ever since 2006 when @[1047678684:2048:Kylie Kahnke] helped me come up with the idea.

I realized that MOST of the lyrics to my songs describe love tragedies! So I will simply weave them all together and voila! I have already composed the entire soundtrack! The main theme will be "hard-hearted Barbary Allen", who realizes her mistake only once it is too late. The different verses will play as a recurring motif throughout the drama, moving the story forward.

This melody is the lesser- known one for the poem. I pretty much hate the popular one which Johnny Cash uses and so many others. Search for it on YouTube if you want to vomit with me. I suppose it's not actually terrible... but compared to the supreme epicness of this one it sends me into immediate "no, no, NO shut it off shut it off shut it off" mode! In the comments below, I will post a link to a live musical performance of this melody that I recently found.

To make this track, I started with the audio of the lovely Jean Ritchie singing the tune a-cappella. Without ever hearing it in a harmonic or rhythmic setting, I had to speed it up and time-stretch it to a dance beat and figure out how I wanted to interpret the chord progression. But the moment that I struck remix gold was when I added the musical fill in order to bring it to an even number of measures (You know... that little flute dittie that echos the vocal)!

In addition to transforming this song into a drama, there will also be a new dance track produced in the future. It will have fewer verses, more developed musical breaks and vocal harmonies, and more drum programming.

One last interesting note about this tune:

It is the only time I EVER used the "Modern Talking" patch in Massive. That's the one everybody used to do the super- annoying cheesy Dubstep noises, but I used it in a really subtle way.

My friend Spin is cycling 130 miles for charity:

"Temwa supports people in remote, rural areas of northern Malawi, now the poorest country in the world. They train villagers to grow a variety of vegetables and fruit to improve their nutritional intake; plant trees to combat the devastating effects of deforestation, run HIV testing clinics and work to combat the associated stigma and fund students through their secondary school education."

Please help her reach her goal if you are able!

Austin kicks ass, guys! I came here to meet the crew of The Atheist Experience and volunteer in the control room, and they have been more welcoming and supportive than I could have expected. 

Then there is the local street scene, which is vital for my lifestyle. Money is very difficult to make, but a solid sub-network of friendly co-dwellers makes the struggle worthwhile.

But what completely surprised me... are the Christians! Just for fun, I began a weekly Bible study at the university. And... I'm almost flabbergasted by how much these guys have embraced me. Having previously been a total believer, then shattered by doubt, I now realize that since religion is never going to go away, and that theists are definitely not stupid, that the best path for me is to play along with them, and this can absolutely be done without being in any way disingenuous. Call it a kind of revelation I've had. You can actually have faith while accepting all the doubts, and this overcomes the danger that is caused by cognitive dissonance. I've been going to their gatherings, making friends with them and conducting study sessions, giving me the opportunity to teach again since these guys are endlessly fascinated by the Jewish tradition. 

When I stopped being religious I wanted nothing more than to move on to "relevant" areas of study and get over all the time I had invested into something that I could no longer accept as real. But my interest in religion never actually went away, no matter how fed up and embarrassed by it I had become. My discovery of atheism filled the void, but is in reality an integral part of the religious continuum.

Now it is time to put it all together and build bridges, and continue to learn and inspire people like we always have. After all... what would Jesus do?

A big thank you to those who donated to my Go Fund Me campaign to get back in school! Here's the latest update, and I'll post another link to the website down in the comments: Well... thanks to the recurring monthly donor, I'm actually WAY closer to reaching the goal than it seems! This is really gonna work! When I call the agency to negotiate a payment plan, I'll be able to tell them I can make a down payment and $20 a month. They will most likely notify the school that the loan is being payed back so they can release the transcript hold! YAY! You guys ROCK!!!

Hi! So I just found my old bio on here and made some adjustments. And since quite a lot of time was put into it, and hardly anyone really looks at those anyway, I ought to post it here, just for kicks, and also as a way to introduce myself to those who don't know me so well:

I'm a 90s-obsessed uke-freak recording-junkie ex-Hasid cartoon self-parody.

I don't get paid for it, but it justifies my existence.

I have facial paralysis due to a cholesteatoma inside my skull. It's benign, but I have to have a craniotomy once every 10 years or so to have it removed, or else it would go into my brain and kill me.

I found out more recently that I have Raynaud's disease which caused me to lose the use of my left hand last year. So... that, together with my previous physical limitations means I now have one ear, one good eye, half an animated face, and one hand. Humans are inherently highly lateralized creatures, but have evolved to present an illusion of symmetry. I, however, have nothing to hide. I'm completely twisted and proud of it.

It is intuitive to resist labels, because every being is absolutely unique. Things do not neatly fit into clear categories like we would like them to. However, since they are not only unavoidable, but vital for enabling our understanding of the world and each other, here are a bunch of labels that I am relatively comfortable with (Just whatever you do.... NEVER call me a hippie! I only look like one so that I can fill my niche in the adult entertainment industry. On my time off, I EAT hippies for dinner):

Scientific Materialist
Myers-Briggs: INFP (this may have changed recently as I have somewhat developed my reasoning skills and apply them to my decisions as much as possible)
Humor Style: Idiot Savant

Cartoon Avatar: Daria. She's my girlfriend, and one day I'll meet my real Daria.
Personality Defect: Brute
57% Nerd, 52% Dork, 47% Slut.

This one started out as a Paganini violin caprice. I didn't change a single note of the composition, I just arranged it for bass and lead synths, put it to a drum beat and added the Yosemite Sam samples.

Paganini was cool. He was the original musician of the Faustian legend in which he sold his soul to the devil in exchange for superhuman talent. He did stuff on the violin that simply was not done before, and supposedly no one has come close since. It's said that he would purposely file nicks into his strings so they would break during his performance, after which he would finish the song on one string. He was classical, but had folk influences which are particularly apparent on this track. The melody really sounds like a bunny hopping through the forest, being chased by an axe-weilding maniac.

I had breakfast with the physics professor again and I told him I've been struggling with understanding the nature of time. He excitedly showed me a scientific paper explaining an alternative cosmological model because... 

(you should probably put a drum roll or something here because what follows is really fucking weird)... 

He doesn't believe in the Big Bang.

This is a guy who co-authored a quantum physics textbook that has been used at UCLA. I'm not sure what to make of this, because he's pretty much saying he thinks the entire scientific community is wrong on this fundamental theory of the universe. I'm highly skeptical, but very excited because now I have a reason to look deeper into it.

Oh, and how was that supposed to relate to my question about time? If this alternative theory is true, then that means time has no beginning and no end.

Today we studied Jesus' first recorded act of faith healing in John 4. The royal official travels all this way because his son is dying, and Jesus basically says, "Get out of my face, he's not gonna die". And guess what? His son got better. Therefore, it was a miracle. #PostHocErgoPropterHoc

"You have to smash people's reality tunnel once in awhile". - Neil deGrasse Tyson

"Fabric of spacetime". I hear this phrase all the time and it is assumed that we know what the hell it means. But if there is no matter in space, how is it anything like fabric? Even more confusing to me is time. I cannot understand time as a "thing" at all, is it not just a unit of measurement by which we order events? I'd love it if someone could explain this to me.

I'm putting my music degree on hold until I get back to Portland. In the meantime I decided to study nutrition, because it is the one topic for which I see the most information thrown around that is essentially folk-wisdom. And everybody has to eat so it is always relevant! Until we transcend our humanity that is, which I very much hope to be a part of.

I've heard it said that the experience of hitchhiking causes you to meet yourself. You have to cast your fate to the world, accepting the random juxtaposition of fear and absolute frustration towards humanity when forced to wait hours or days without any help, interspersed with the occasional kind soul who restores your faith, resulting in overwhelming joy. This teaches you about yourself through discovering how you deal with it. Right now, friends, I am struggling. My feet hurt so bad, I haven't slept and I have no choice but to push through the pain, exhaustion and mental anguish. I am so thankful for all your moral support.

Late last night, as I was confidently making my way off of Bourbon St. to continue Westward, I was aggressively approached by a dancer named Alexandria (or Indica, if you will). We shared a rather intimate encounter which was cut short just as quickly as it was initiated, though not before she made sure I had her contact info. She does not have mine, so I cannot, as I am accustomed to, passively wait for her to make the advance or not; it has to be my decision. I am unsure how to negotiate this particular entanglement, and furthermore, I am now unsure whether to stay here or not. The only thing I am sure of is... I have here a most incredible song to write.

I can't play ukulele on Bourbon St. after 8pm. But I *could* become a terrorist, stand in the road with a giant cross and a microphone, and threaten people with eternal punishment unless they surrender to a mythological dictator
Desperate for rest and warmth 'till my train leaves in the morning, I check into a homeless shelter. Dayum... This is more annoying than county jail!

This old burnout pretended to give me like 25 drops of white fluff, hoping I would kick him a few bucks for his "kindness". Good thing I didn't, 'cause it was bad enough that I had to chew on his soggy bus pass for nothing.

It's been awhile since I've posted a health update. My wounds are healing well and every week when I visit my specialist he notices slight improvement in my hand and finger movement. However... I am having to deal without any pain medication, which is impeding the healing process and lowering my quality of life greatly. Why is this? . . .

When I was recently living in Oregon I had a prescription for medical marijuana. Use of this wonderful plant has helped greatly with my nerve pain as well as lifted my spirits. Now here in New York it is thankfully about to be legalized. But since I have tested positive for this substance, I am no longer allowed to be prescribed any narcotics. I still have extensive nerve and tissue damage that needs to be healed before I will be even close to comfortable without this medication, but the excessively strict laws prevent me from having access to it.

What do you think of this?

Yesterday while I was waiting for the bus, a mosquito bit me right on my bad arm. What a cruel joke, right? But then again, at least there was blood in the arm for the mosquito to drink, since the circulation has returned. And for that matter... at least the arm exists in the first place to attract the mosquito, since it was just dangerously close to being amputated! This wouldn't have been possible without all of you who have stuck with me through all of this. Much love to you.

data.post:
I'm starting to be able to move my hand again! Right now it's just a twitch in the wrist and a couple fingers but guess what? That's good enough! The difference between something and nothing is infinite, and this means I'll be able to work on it, starting with the ukulele since it takes so little pressure.

Just to be clear: They did NOT say that I can go home tomorrow! All they said was that we would TALK about it. So I was afraid of getting anyone's hopes up. But when the surgeons saw me this morning, they sounded a lot more sure. I think it's actually gonna happen! They don't need me here anymore, I'm just sitting around in their bed, eating their food, taking their pills and using their Wi-Fi. All so that they can pop in once a day, look at my hand and say "yep looks good, keep it up"!

They're talking about maybe getting me out of here on Monday. I've sure had enough of this hospital. I wanna go home, and hang out with Rebecca, and Brian and Michelle and Bosco and Buddy and Comfort! Then I can bring my fingers back to life by playing music! I'm writing songs for the new album right now, it's gonna be sick! Like demons and shit. See you all soon.
